title: Truss Teetering
itunes:title: Truss Teetering
description:
There is "no non-Hunger Games outcome" to the crisis facing Liz Truss, according to Bloomberg's political reporter Alex Wickham. He joins Yuan Potts and Stephen Carroll as the Prime Minister meets Graham Brady, the Chairman of the 1922 Committee of backbench Conservative MPs. Truss's government is on the verge of collapse after 24 hours which saw resignations, un-resignations, and a shambolic parliamentary vote that included claims of MPs being "manhandled" into the voting lobby. Also in the show, University of Liverpool politics professor Jon Tonge tells us this is a '10/10 level of crisis' and why the current situation reminds him of 1997. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
content:encoded:
There is "no non-Hunger Games outcome" to the crisis facing Liz Truss, according to Bloomberg's political reporter Alex Wickham. He joins Yuan Potts and Stephen Carroll as the Prime Minister meets Graham Brady, the Chairman of the 1922 Committee of backbench Conservative MPs. Truss's government is on the verge of collapse after 24 hours which saw resignations, un-resignations, and a shambolic parliamentary vote that included claims of MPs being "manhandled" into the voting lobby. Also in the show, University of Liverpool politics professor Jon Tonge tells us this is a '10/10 level of crisis' and why the current situation reminds him of 1997. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
itunes:author: Bloomberg
